course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Computational Chemistry
course.description: Fundamentals and applications of various computational chemistry methods, including molecular orbital calculations, molecular mechanics and molecular dynamics. Computational laboratory practice will be emphasized.

reviews.author: klchan001
reviews.comment_content:
Topics:
Quantum Mechanics
Protein Structure and Dynamics
Molecular Mechanics Force Field
Molecular Dynamics Monte Carlo
Protein Structure and Dynamics
Free Energy Calculations
Docking

Software:
Gaussian
Gromacs
Maestro
AutoDock
reviews.comment_teaching: Both Professors are kind and knowledgable. But the student teaching tutorial part varies in quality. It may be a bit hard to follow sometimes especially in online mode.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading consists of 2 parts: 1. Software Tutorial 40% ; 2. Final Group Project 60%
For Software Tutorial, I believe that the grading is good as long as you can deliver clearly. Prof. Pan prefers a more listener-friendly presentation I think.
For Final Group Project, it may be hard to find a suitable topic for the whole group. Many of the time I think is 1 or 2 people is very familiar with the tool or topic and then lead the other members. There is also a Q&A section.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload depends on the group members and the topic you choose for your final group project. The workload for written report is highest I think.

reviews.author: Vince
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture:
Quantum Mechanics
Density Functional Theory
Molecular Mechanics and Force Fields
Molecular Dynamics and Monte Carlo
Modeling Protein Structure and Dynamics
Free energy Calculation
Docking

Lab (computational tools using a virtual box or you can opt to use the  assigned computer barn for this course):
Gaussian
Molecular Modelling using Maestro
Gromacs MD
Protein Dynamics
Auto-Dock
reviews.comment_teaching: Great instructors! very skilled and knowledgeable. One is an expert in atomistic computation while the other is more inclined in macromolecular systems computation. Overall, a highly balanced perspective.
reviews.comment_grading:
Computational tool Software tutorial (40 %)
Final Project (60%)

Good grading, just do well in the class requirements.
For the tutorial, it is recommended to make it clear and give a good demonstration of the software application. I was able to demonstrate most of the software applications clearly (live), yeah like typing the codes while explaining them in class. This will ensure a 100 mark.

It is recommended to combine computational tools in the final project to get valuable results and thus ensure high grades (A+). Remember to plan it carefully to not mess up during the project presentation and report writing.
reviews.comment_workload:
1. Computational tool Software tutorial as midterm

2. The final requirement is a mini- Project which applies at least one or a combination of software taught in the class.
This includes project presentation and report writing.

reviews.author: holymama
reviews.title: 刷grade一定要讀
reviews.comment_content:
Quantum Mechanics
Density Functional Theory
Molecular Mechanics and Force Fields
Molecular Dynamics and Monte Carlo
Modeling Protein Structure and Dynamics
Free energy Calculation
Docking

Lab:
Gaussian
Molecular Modelling using Maestro
Gromacs MD

自己分組，每組輪流教一個lab topic, 跟住一齊做一個project

Compututation Software tutorial (40 %)
Final Project (60%)
reviews.comment_teaching: 上堂教嘅theory一d都冇用，我都淨係認真去學用software咋，反而有用好多，橫掂唔洗考試，嘻
reviews.comment_grading:
你唔會知自己幾多分，但係你SIS就會多左個A+
冇做過任何特別表現嘅野，某程度上group project都係hea hea地，因為一定有人carry
當然啦唔好咩都唔做
reviews.comment_workload: 0 workload，software點樣用可以上網學完就教到人，除非你想你final project好perfect

reviews.author: 落叶飘满天空
reviews.title: 好課
reviews.comment_content:
每次上課前面上LEC，學一些理論
Quantum Mechanics
Molecular MechanicsForce Field
Molecular DynamicsMonte Carlo
Protein Structure and Dynamics
Free EnergyCalculations
Docking

後面上TUT，（六個小組每個組）教用計算軟件
Quantum Mechanics - Gaussian
Molecular Mechanics - Maestro
MD and MC - Gromacs
Protein Dynamics - Gromacs
Free Energy - Gromacs
Docking - AutoDock
reviews.comment_teaching: 教得不錯，學到很多，但是其實一兩堂課根本不足以講完所有內容，想深入學還是得看大塊頭教材。（但是這些全部不考，所以不聽也沒事）
reviews.comment_grading:
40%給TUT，每個小組上去教全班怎麼使用計算軟件
60%給project，presentation加report
好龜，畢竟PG課

reviews.author: Dawn
reviews.comment_content:
The content could be pretty difficult without background in quantum chemistry. The professors went through the materials pretty quickly, and they assumed that you already had some basic knowledge for quantum chemistry. The course introduced how to use some basic software packages including Maestro
(Macromodel), Gromacs, AutoDock, Pymol, and Gaussian.

Syllabus:
1) Quantum Mechanics; software: Gaussian
2) Molecular Mechanics and Force Fields; software: Molecular modeling using Maestro
3) Molecular Dynamics and Monte Carlo; software: Gromacs MD
4) Modeling Protein Structure and Dynamics; software: Protein dynamics
5) Free Energy Calculations; software: Free energy calculations
6) Docking; software: Docking using Auto-dock
reviews.comment_teaching:
Both Professor Ding and Professor Su are pretty friendly. If you had any question, just ask and they would  answer them.
Professor Ding taught the first part of the course: Quantum mechanics, Molecular Mechanics and Force Fields, Molecular Dynamics and Monte Carlo. The class goes pretty fast, the content was pretty dense. It would be interesting if you are interested in quantum chemistry and computational simulation. Despite the difficulty, since there were no final exams, it was okay.

Professor Su taught the second half of the course: Modeling Protein Structure and Dynamics, Free Energy Calculations and Docking. This part of the course is slightly easier.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is pretty good. The grade is based on two presentations:
1) Group tutorial presentation that teaches the rest of the students in the class how to do the software application you are assigned to. For example Gromacs
2) Final group Project Presentation + Report. For the project you should base the calculation on of the software introduced during the course.

The tutorial presentation takes 40% of the final grade; the final group project (presentation and report) takes 60% of the grade.

The grade was pretty fair
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is pretty light because there are no exams, and you only need to prepare presentations and finish a report.
